parameter 1: For syndicated rerun release, the introductions and wrap-ups by Powell, Dick (q.v.) were replaced with new ones featuring 'Keenan Wynn' (qv), and the program was retitled "The Westerners."
parameter 2: Kino International Corp. copyrighted and released a video in 2000, produced by Jessica Rosner with a piano score composed and performed by Jon Mirsalis. It was made from a Library of Congress preservation print and runs 63 minutes.
parameter 3: All episodes featured on this tape were originally broadcast as part of _"Doctor Who" (1963)_ (qv).
parameter 4: UK cinema and video versions were cut by a second to briefly shorten the scene in Columbia where Rico shoots a man in the head. The footage was restored for the 2003 DVD release.
parameter 5: UK theatrical version was cut by 1 min. to secure a PG rating. Video version is uncut and has a 15 rating.
parameter 6: All episodes featured on this tape were originally broadcast as part of _"Doctor Who" (1963)_ (qv).
parameter 7: On the Region 1 DVD set from A&E Home Video, this episode has been modified to have the regular theme song (sung by Cathi Campo) at the beginning, instead of the original version of the theme song that was sung by a man.
parameter 8: All UK versions are cut by 5 secs to remove a cockfight.
parameter 9: On the Region 1 DVD set from A&E Home Video, this episode has been modified to have the regular theme song (sung by Cathi Campo) at the beginning, instead of the original version of the theme song that was sung by a man.
parameter 10: This production was initially aired (in the U.K. on the BBC and in the U.S. on PBS stations) in a one-hour form called simply "Thirty Years In The Tardis" in 1993. Bits and pieces from various archival sources (including everything between Parts One and Two and between Parts Two and Three, which in the original PBS showings were pledge drive breaks) were carefully edited in to bring it to its video edition running time.
parameter 11: All UK versions are cut by 5 secs to remove a cockfight.
parameter 12: Large portions of the scene where fei (sammo) is playing mahjong and is found by the gangsters is cut from many international versions of the film - because it was felt that the game of mahjong isn't well known enough in many countries for it to be so prominently featured.
parameter 13: UK theatrical version was cut by 1 min. to secure a PG rating. Video version is uncut and has a 15 rating.
parameter 14: UK theatrical version was cut by 1 min. to secure a PG rating. Video version is uncut and has a 15 rating.
parameter 15: For syndicated rerun release, the introductions and wrap-ups by Powell, Dick (q.v.) were replaced with new ones featuring 'Keenan Wynn' (qv), and the program was retitled "The Westerners."
parameter 16: The US version deletes scenes from the HK version
parameter 17: This movie was also shown in two parts as episode 1 and 2 of the following series.
parameter 18: This movie was also shown in two parts as episode 1 and 2 of the following series.

parameter 20: UK cinema and video versions were cut by a second to briefly shorten the scene in Columbia where Rico shoots a man in the head. The footage was restored for the 2003 DVD release.
parameter 21: This movie was also shown in two parts as episode 1 and 2 of the following series.
parameter 22: The US version deletes scenes from the HK version
parameter 23: For its repeated showings following the original broadcast, the series was heavily edited in order to remove the many racial slurs thrown at the different African characters, as well as blur-out copyrighted logos and brand-names seen and spoken throughout the series. Some clips were also removed from the opening causing noticeable jumps in the soundtrack.
parameter 24: This production was initially aired (in the U.K. on the BBC and in the U.S. on PBS stations) in a one-hour form called simply "Thirty Years In The Tardis" in 1993. Bits and pieces from various archival sources (including everything between Parts One and Two and between Parts Two and Three, which in the original PBS showings were pledge drive breaks) were carefully edited in to bring it to its video edition running time.
parameter 25: The syndicated rerun package does not include episode 2.21, "The Sharpshooter," as it is the pilot for the series _"Rifleman, The" (1958)_ (qv), and was reworked to be its premiere episode. Consequently, that rerun package is where it is to be seen.
parameter 26: This movie was also shown in two parts as episode 1 and 2 of the following series.
parameter 27: 2005 DVD release features modified versions of several episodes, with improved special effects and coloring, and alternate versions of some scenes substituted for the original televised versions. In addition, newly written and produced scenes were added to some episodes in order to improve continuity. All dialogue by the character Clavius was re-recorded by another actor for the DVD release.
parameter 28: An extended version of this documentary is included in the 2004 box set release "Lost in Time". It includes additional interviews discussing episodes located between 1998 (when the original documentary was produced) and 2004.
parameter 29: With the exception of "An Unearthly Child" which was never broadcast, the other episodes featured on this tape were originally broadcast as part of _"Doctor Who" (1963)_ (qv). A recreated version of the complete episode "The Crusade" was later released as _Doctor Who: The Crusade (1999) (V)_ (qv).
parameter 30: This movie was also shown in two parts as episode 1 and 2 of the following series.
parameter 31: For its repeated showings following the original broadcast, the series was heavily edited in order to remove the many racial slurs thrown at the different African characters, as well as blur-out copyrighted logos and brand-names seen and spoken throughout the series. Some clips were also removed from the opening causing noticeable jumps in the soundtrack.
